name: bimetallism
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the use of two metals, for example gold and silver, as the standard against which the value of a currency (= the money used in a particular country) is calculated: The monetary system of the United States was based on bimetallism for most of the 19th century. Compare
monometallismRelated word
bimetallic
More examplesFewer examplesWhen governments used both gold and silver standards this was known as bimetallism.The Gold Standard Act of the United States established gold as the only standard for redeeming paper money, ending bimetallism.
